articles.title: Readers: What’s your favorite spot for apple picking?
articles.description:
It's that time of year again. Help us update our guide to the best apple orchards.

The post Readers: What’s your favorite spot for apple picking? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston.com seeks reader input on favorite apple orchards for updated guide.
The article encourages community engagement for the 2025 apple picking season.
Local residents can discover popular orchards, enhancing fall activities in the area.

articles.title: Another New Hampshire man gets a pig kidney as transplant trials are poised to start
articles.description:
Based on lessons from the New Hampshire men and a handful of other one-off attempts, the Food and Drug Administration approved pig producer eGenesis to begin a rigorous study of kidney xenotransplants.

The post Another New Hampshire man gets a pig kidney as transplant trials are poised to start appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: FDA approved eGenesis to start kidney xenotransplant trials, impacting local transplant options.
New Hampshire man receives a pig kidney, part of a broader study involving multiple patients.
Boston residents may benefit from increased organ availability and innovative transplant solutions.

articles.title: ‘An unfathomable tragedy.’ Lloyd Young, Globe photo editor and avid athlete, dies at 57.
articles.description:
Each day Lloyd Young examined thousands of images as the photo editor for the front page of The Boston Globe, playing a key role in choosing the first pictures readers see in print and online. He had begun his career shooting photos for his high school yearbook and college newspaper, though, and always remembered what […]

The post ‘An unfathomable tragedy.’ Lloyd Young, Globe photo editor and avid athlete, dies at 57. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Lloyd Young, 57, Boston Globe photo editor, passed away, impacting local journalism.
Young curated thousands of images daily, shaping the visual narrative for Boston residents.
His death leaves a significant void in the local media community and among athletes.

articles.title: Photos: Highlights from Day 2 at Seisiún Irish music festival in Boston
articles.description:
The venue remained wet, but the crowds and bands were undeterred at Suffolk Downs Sunday.

The post Photos: Highlights from Day 2 at Seisiún Irish music festival in Boston appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Suffolk Downs hosted Day 2 of the Seisiún Irish music festival on September 8.
Crowds enjoyed performances despite wet conditions, showcasing local resilience and community spirit.
The festival supports local artists and boosts Boston's cultural scene, attracting visitors.

articles.title: Powerball’s $1.8 billion jackpot: 2 winning tickets sold
articles.description:
Each ticket holder will have the choice between an annuitized prize of $893.5 million or a lump sum payment of $410.3 million.

The post Powerball’s $1.8 billion jackpot: 2 winning tickets sold appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Two winning Powerball tickets sold, each worth $1.8 billion jackpot.
Winners can choose between $893.5 million annuity or $410.3 million lump sum.
Local businesses may see increased spending from winners in Boston area.

articles.title: Mike Vrabel on Drake Maye, Will Campbell, and Bill Belichick’s comments about banning Patriots scouts
articles.description:
Vrabel said he appreciated Patriots' fan support even in tough times: "I want to be able to thank them when they're loud on third down."

The post Mike Vrabel on Drake Maye, Will Campbell, and Bill Belichick’s comments about banning Patriots scouts appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Mike Vrabel acknowledged Patriots fans' support during tough games, emphasizing community connection.
Vrabel expressed gratitude for fan noise during critical moments, like third downs.
Bill Belichick's comments on banning scouts may affect future scouting strategies in Boston.
